marketNews.title: Government Said to Soon Lift iPhone 16 Sales Ban
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Indonesian government and Apple Inc. have agreed on terms to lift the ban on the sale of the iPhone 16 series in Indonesia, ending five months of negotiations that led Apple to increase its investment offer by 100 times to US$1 billion. Bloomberg cited that the Ministry of Industry will sign a memorandum of agreement with Apple this week. Neither Apple nor the Ministry has commented on the news. In addition to the US$1 billion investment, Bloomberg said Apple will commit to training local communities in research and development (R&D) through programs beyond the existing Apple Developer Academy. Bloomberg also reported that Apple does not plan to produce iPhones in Indonesia immediately. In December 2024 Bloomberg reported that the US$1 billion investment included building an AirTag factory in Batam targeting 20% of global AirTag production. The agreement news came almost two months after Minister of Industry Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita met Apple Vice President of Global Policy Nick Ammann in early January 2025, where the minister said the US$1 billion investment was insufficient and urged Apple to build an iPhone component factory in Indonesia to obtain a domestic component certificate (TKDN). Last week, Agus said Apple had paid an investment debt of US$10 million, the remaining commitment from the 2020-2024 period. Key Takeaway: The lifting of the iPhone 16 sales ban in Indonesia could boost sales of Apple product distributors such as ERAA and MAPI.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia bond purchase plan sparks governance and monetization concerns
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Bank Indonesia's plan to purchase government bonds issued to finance a program to build three million houses per year raises concerns about debt monetization and governance. Monetization refers to the government borrowing from the central bank instead of issuing bonds to private investors or raising taxes. Lionel Priyadi, Fixed Income and Macro Strategist at PT Mega Capital, told Bloomberg that the government should clarify the housing bond structure, otherwise the market may interpret the issuance as a potential widening of the fiscal deficit, which could push up government bond yields.

marketNews.title: Gunbuster Nickel Industry says operations continue despite smelter challenges
marketNews.content: Gunbuster Nickel Industry said its operations continue as usual and as optimal as possible following news that one of Indonesia's largest nickel smelters is cutting production and may close completely. The company explained that it is undergoing operational management changes to strengthen its structure. Kontan reported that Gunbuster previously obtained a syndicated loan of IDR 19.32 trillion (US$1.29 billion) for 2023-2028 involving five banks: BMRI (US$429.98 million), BBNI (US$337.41 million), BBCA (US$259.4 million), China Construction Bank, and KB Bukopin (BBKP). As of end-2024, BMRI’s loan portfolio was IDR 1,671 trillion, BBNI’s IDR 776 trillion, BBCA’s IDR 922 trillion, and BBKP’s IDR 41 trillion.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's DHE SDA regulation still pending detailed guidance
marketNews.content: The Acting Director General of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association said on Monday that the association has not yet received detailed regulations from the government regarding the foreign exchange proceeds from natural resource export (DHE SDA) that can be converted to rupiah. The revised DHE SDA regulation, effective 1 March 2025, will allow exporters to use foreign exchange placed in a special account for several purposes, including conversion to rupiah in the same bank for operational needs.

marketNews.title: Three Pertamina unit executives arrested over alleged oil import corruption
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Attorney General arrested three executives from Pertamina subsidiaries on Monday for alleged corruption related to crude oil imports that allegedly caused state losses of IDR 193.7 trillion. The arrested individuals are Riva Siahaan (President Director of PT Pertamina Patra Niaga), Yoki Firnandi (President Director of PT Pertamina International Shipping), and Sani Dinar Saifuddin (President Director of PT Kilang Pertamina Internasional). Prosecutors allege they colluded to justify crude oil and fuel imports, violating regulations that require Pertamina to source crude oil from domestic suppliers.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Stock Exchange launches foreign index futures (KBIA)
marketNews.content: The IDX launched a new derivative product called the foreign index futures contract (KBIA) on Tuesday, aiming to broaden market access and provide portfolio diversification options. In its initial phase, IDX partnered with MSCI to launch KBIA based on the MSCI Hong Kong Listed Large Cap index. According to Antara, KBIA offers several advantages: it allows trading of foreign market securities while remaining an investor in the Indonesian capital market; it can be used in both bullish and bearish market conditions with long or short positions; it provides leverage up to 33 times with a contract size of IDR 10,000 per index point, requiring roughly IDR 200,000 for a transaction; and profits are settled in cash within one trading day (T+1).

tickerNews.title: Apple distributor ERAA shares rise 3.74% after iPhone 16 ban lift
tickerNews.content: Apple distributor ERAA contributed approximately 46% of total COGS for the first nine months of 2024. On Tuesday (25/2) ERAA shares rose 3.74%.

tickerNews.title: Apple distributor MAPI shares fall 2.03% after iPhone 16 ban lift
tickerNews.content: Apple distributor MAPI contributed approximately 16% of sales for the first nine months of 2024. On Tuesday (25/2) MAPI shares fell 2.03%.

tickerNews.title: BBCA CEO Jahja Setiaatmadja purchases 337,000 BBCA shares
tickerNews.content: Bank Central Asia's President Director Jahja Setiaatmadja bought 337,000 BBCA shares at an average price of IDR 8,900 per share on 25 February 2025. The transaction value was about IDR 3 billion. After the transaction, Jahja's ownership in BBCA increased but remains around 0.03%.

tickerNews.title: BMRI reports net profit of 4 trillion rupiah in January 2025
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri recorded a net profit of IDR 4 trillion for January 2025 (+4.5% YoY, +1.1% MoM), roughly in line with the consensus estimate of +5% YoY. The performance was driven by a credit cost (CoC) of 0.52% (down from 0.65% in Jan 2024 and a reversal of -0.03% in Dec 2024) and loan growth of 19.3% YoY (vs. 19.6% YoY in Jan 2024 and 20.7% YoY in Dec 2024), with the loan-to-deposit ratio improving to 93.7%. Net interest margin fell to 4.42% (-8 bps YoY, -59 bps MoM) and operating expenses rose 23% YoY due to higher staff costs (+26% YoY) and other expenses (+18% YoY).

tickerNews.title: Bukalapak controlling shareholder PT Kreatif Media Karya buys ~9.7 billion BUKA shares
tickerNews.content: PT Kreatif Media Karya purchased approximately 9.7 billion BUKA shares at an average price of IDR 138 per share on 24 February 2025, for a total transaction value of about IDR 1.3 trillion. After the transaction, its ownership in BUKA rose from 24.61% to 34.05%. The transaction had previously been reported in a Stockbit Snips article on Monday (24/2).

tickerNews.title: Four HRTA directors and commissioner purchase total 1.81 million shares
tickerNews.content: Four members of Hartadinata Abadi's board and commissioners bought a total of 1,810,000 HRTA shares on 21 February 2025: Sandra Sunanto 450,000 shares, Ong Deny 470,000 shares, Fendy Wijaya 450,000 shares, and Cuncun Muliawan 440,000 shares. The combined transaction value was IDR 1.03 billion at an average price of IDR 566.3 per share.

tickerNews.title: MBMA signs HPAL smelter agreement with 1.8 billion USD project
tickerNews.content: Merdeka Battery Materials announced it has signed an agreement with a strategic partner to build an HPAL smelter with a production capacity of 90,000 tons of nickel MHP per year in Indonesia's Morowali Industrial Park. The smelter construction, valued at US$1.8 billion, started in January 2025 and is expected to reach commissioning within 18 months. The smelter will be operated by MBMA's subsidiary PT Sulawesi Nickel Cobalt, processing laterite nickel ore from MBMA's SCM mine in Konawe, Southeast Sulawesi, under a 20-year commercial agreement. PT Sulawesi Nickel Cobalt has secured a credit facility of US$1.4 billion with a 7-year tenor from Bangkok Bank, Bank Permata (BNLI), BMRI, Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) to support the project.

tickerNews.title: Toba Energy Vice President Pandu Sjahrir resigns to become CIO at Danantara
tickerNews.content: Pandu Sjahrir, Vice President of Toba Energy, announced he will resign from his position at the company after being appointed Chief Investment Officer at Danantara Investment Management. He stated he will step down only from roles related to industry and business, while remaining active within the organization.

tickerNews.title: POWR reports net profit 118 billion rupiah in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: Cikarang Listrindo recorded a net profit of IDR 118 billion in 4Q24 (vs. IDR 551 billion in 3Q24 and a loss of IDR 1 billion in 4Q23). The 2024 net profit totals IDR 1.2 trillion (+2.4% YoY). Revenue in 4Q24 grew to IDR 2.6 trillion (+47% QoQ, +25% YoY), bringing 2024 revenue to IDR 8.8 trillion (+4.8% YoY).

tickerNews.title: JSMR closes subsidiary PT Jalantol Lingkarluar Jakarta, assets 19.3 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: Jasa Marga announced the closure of its subsidiary PT Jalantol Lingkarluar Jakarta through dissolution and liquidation. The remaining assets, valued at approximately IDR 19.3 billion, will be distributed to shareholders proportionally. JSMR owned 99.99% of the subsidiary as of 30 September 2024. The liquidation aims to stop the subsidiary's losses.

tickerNews.title: DOID secures $250 million credit facility from BBCA
tickerNews.content: Delta Dunia Makmur, through its subsidiary PT Bukit Makmur Mandiri Utama, signed an accordion facility of up to US$250 million from BBCA, comprising a US$75 million dollar-denominated facility and a rupiah-denominated facility of about IDR 2.9 trillion. DOID stated the facility will positively impact the company's financial flexibility.

tickerNews.title: DATA shareholders Djoni and Verah Wong increase holdings
tickerNews.content: Remala Abadi shareholder Djoni bought approximately 5.2 million DATA shares at an average price of IDR 1,612 per share on 20 February 2025, for a total transaction value of about IDR 8.4 billion. After the transaction, Djoni's ownership rose from 4.71% to 5.09%. In a separate transaction, DATA's controlling shareholder and President Commissioner Verah Wahyudi S. Wong bought about 93.1 million DATA shares at an average price of IDR 270 per share on 21 February 2025, a price 87% lower than the closing price of IDR 2,120 per share on the same day, for a total value of about IDR 25.1 billion. After the transaction, Verah's ownership increased from 76.8% to 83.57%.

tickerNews.title: BNII reports net profit 558 billion rupiah in 4Q24
tickerNews.content: Maybank Indonesia recorded a net profit of IDR 558 billion in 4Q24 (+12% YoY, +30% QoQ), resulting in a 2024 net profit of IDR 1.1 trillion (-36% YoY). Net interest income fell to IDR 1.8 trillion in 4Q24 (-2.7% YoY, -2.1% QoQ), bringing 2024 NII to IDR 7.1 trillion (-1.8% YoY). Net interest margin declined to 4.37% (-59 bps YoY). Operating expenses grew 8.5% YoY, reducing pre-provision operating profit by 15% YoY. Provisions increased 23% YoY. Credit growth was 10% YoY in 2024 (vs. 7.6% YoY in 2023).

tickerNews.title: APEX secures $4.8 million contract from Pertamina Hulu Mahakam
tickerNews.content: Apexindo Pratama Duta obtained a contract worth US$4.8 million from PT Pertamina Hulu Mahakam for offshore drilling work in the Delta Mahakam area of East Kalimantan for three months.

tickerNews.title: SOSS shares bought ~4 million by PT Alsok Bass Indonesia, while PT Inlife sells same amount
tickerNews.content: Shield On Service (SOSS) saw approximately 4 million shares purchased by PT Alsok Bass Indonesia Security Services at an average price of IDR 590 per share on 12 February 2025, for a total transaction value of about IDR 2.4 billion. After the purchase, Alsok's ownership rose from 79.33% to 79.83%. On the same day, shareholder PT Inlife sold the same number of shares at the same average price, reducing its ownership from 5% to 4.5%.
